title: 115_hr4707
content: The "Procure PGMS For Israel Act" aims to address the threat posed by Hezbollah to Israel by ensuring an adequate supply of precision guided munitions. This includes conducting a joint assessment of the quantity needed for Israel's defense. The President, through the Secretary of Defense, is authorized to conduct a joint assessment with Israel regarding the quantity and type of precision guided munitions needed to combat Hezbollah. The assessment also includes Israel's plan to acquire these munitions and the potential role of the United States in assisting with the plan. A report must be submitted to Congress within 15 days of completing the assessment. The Secretary must submit a report to Congress containing the joint assessment. SEC. 4. AMENDMENT TO DEPARTMENT OF DEFENSE APPROPRIATIONS ACT, 2005. Section 12001 of the Department of Defense Appropriations Act, 2005 is amended to authorize the President to add precision guided munitions to reserve stocks for Israel and transfer them for Israel's defense against rockets. The President is authorized to transfer precision guided munitions to Israel for defense against rockets, with certification required before the transfer to ensure it meets specific criteria and does not harm US interests or commitments. Congress believes the Department of Defense should collaborate with the defense industry to enhance the production of precision guided munitions for swift resupply in combating ISIL and supporting allies like Israel against Hezbollah. Additionally, there will be modifications to rapid acquisition and deployment procedures. The Bob Stump National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2003 is amended to include procedures for urgently needed support in producing precision guided munitions for counterterrorism missions and assisting allies under direct missile threat from designated terrorist organizations. The Secretary of Defense shall prescribe procedures for rapid acquisition and deployment of supplies for counterterrorism missions and assisting allies under direct missile threat from designated terrorist organizations, including those supported by Iran. The Secretary of Defense will prescribe procedures for rapid acquisition and deployment of supplies for counterterrorism missions and assisting allies under direct missile threat from designated terrorist organizations, including those supported by Iran, which adversely affects the safety and security of such ally.
